document.title: Wisconsin's Model Academic Standards for Information and Technology Literacy

F5DAEA14D9734AE2B7BB5468637E95CA.description: describe situations or conditions where information is repressed or restricted

6896CD42A9E1405999C959BDFF8B4581.description: acknowledge the right of classmates to express opinions different from their own

A7D89246B97C48E4BC6C86FEA622E37F.description: recognize the importance of free and open access to information for all citizens

91DF7627369E4EA0853854157793159B.description: define the concept of intellectual freedom

F93F29C13D4B4DC79FD842AB1F4F4F53.description: Recognize the importance of intellectual freedom and access to information in a democratic society

A7A1AEBA17064B899619D4C82B58D3EE.description: recognize that reports or articles they write must be put in their own words

4C26ABA3B8BE4EEA81D81327B928961F.description: list sources quoted verbatim and visuals used in a presentation

74836B5EDCE04C11AEDF0AFDB1459E16.description: recognize that a quoted work must be stated in the author's exact words

C845C2F98E15459C87687B9502605723.description: explain why the use of all or parts of another person's work requires prior permission or citation

2391DDD64B0841CA927D4B476A004249.description: identify violations of the copyright law as a crime for which there are serious consequences

A4B06EE08A6E4C7EBD99FC994FB5CA59.description: recognize that the copying of commercial or licensed media is a violation of the copyright law

B039182098744A378F1AF55591D73A23.description: describe how copyright protects the right of an author or producer to control the distribution, performance, display, or copying of original works

4CF81F9005934331AC698D4919049F0D.description: explain the concept of intellectual property rights

082F4BB13C024561868FBEF0A8D612A8.description: recognize the need for privacy of personal information

B9BF8E1B08184FDC835AF7FB85E59A72.description: recognize that using media and technology to defame another person or group constitutes unacceptable behavior

D3928EB06A444F6FB295DBC515D515E6.description: recognize that altering or destroying another person's program or file constitutes unacceptable behavior

AA80A05B7C3440EBA84D3AF84FDA4DE0.description: employ proper etiquette in all forms of communication

EC8EA8248BC64568B589BB933A04A8B0.description: demonstrate use of the Internet and other on-line sources consistent with the school's acceptable use policy

CCF430AD041F4229A645CFDE12B3E2F0.description: identify the school's rules on student use of the Internet and other resources

2D99E1A2E6574786872DAF2CF87F0E57.description: return all borrowed materials on time

2AF17EA851454CA185C11C4BE7AE9C90.description: Use information, media, and technology in a responsible manner

C638895EC5814EE981E2412333ACFAD5.description: review workgroup projects and suggest improvements

150057AB73764140AA17EAF1B7D6F37D.description: complete workgroup projects to meet an established timeline

C3913693186F4320BBB608F3BE192374.description: recognize that individual achievement is linked to the successful completion of workgroup projects

643639C8DD5A493586430D97A90B9202.description: articulate workgroup goals and individual responsibilities within the group participate in the development of individual and workgroup tasks and priorities

42BE1DA486F641C89E7D7E3F9558ACCB.description: share information and ideas with others

D0995D1F9E354354B35722B225E15D0B.description: Participate productively in workgroups or other collaborative learning environments

C4176061928C4B949E0E55A56E90A131.description: Students in Wisconsin will demonstrate the ability to work collaboratively in teams or groups, use information and technology in a responsible manner, respect intellectual property rights, and recognize the importance of intellectual freedom and access to information in a democratic society.

574A7637DA634452801FFE39CC3774C6.description: assess progress and quality of work

8ADE36838DB54BCEB4AD7739348E0D79.description: establish goals and determine steps for completing a project

B8B0E7F89A924A1B9700ADECF3DA764A.description: apply prescribed criteria for judging success of learning projects

4182C471859540C28CB320ACAA3E5AD5.description: identify topics suitable for independent learning or in-depth exploration

57EF1F43E8F64C2891BBF4F479DA3CEA.description: contribute to group or classroom decisions about learning objectives

D063139E46074466BDD0AE32804D049E.description: Demonstrate self-motivation and increasing responsibility for their learning

B213833985434BC292EAAD34715DE585.description: recognize that media can be constructed to convey specific messages, viewpoints, and values

B420FAFAD6764D8CB96B146F25289D5C.description: differentiate among written, oral, and visual forms of literature

94672F5EFDB245B8B6BAE3B661D03A05.description: identify materials that reflect diverse perspectives

3CC20BB998E148E188649394B9B7B6EE.description: choose materials at appropriate developmental levels

C58837FE876144069811BCC1F44D573D.description: Develop competence and selectivity in reading, listening, and viewing

6D13B87066FC49CCB9A316649DAADA12.description: compare their own interpretations of literature and other creative expressions of information with those of others

D7DE982CB1924238AFDF409725B3B326.description: recognize that award winning books reflect literary and artistic excellence relate literature and other creative expressions of information to personal experiences

A0430FD432D048C4A0C6464068E8D85A.description: choose fiction and other literature of personal interest

54BC51CCB61A4F3989382A8567C21329.description: Appreciate and derive meaning from literature and other creative expressions of information

BC366C7D2F5E45A9A520152D4300060B.description: recognize that accurate information is basic to sound decisions

87DF7F951254461CAFD46F39F6C43414.description: recognize that information can be used to make decisions or satisfy personal interest

DC08EAFC2FE5481C8F5D38543761B9BF.description: identify topics of interest and seek relevant information about them

F75707A99C4347BCAA9FD42E4391CF9E.description: Pursue information related to various dimensions of personal well-being and academic success

CF270CE09C92487D90C5870ABF7CCF4D.description: Students in Wisconsin will apply information and technology skills to issues of personal and academic interest by actively and independently seeking information; demonstrating critical and discriminating reading, listening, and viewing habits; and, striving for personal excellence in learning and career pursuits.

D52DD4208696427AB2257BF79CAFDB30.description: suggest ways in which the process and product can be improved

F913C9FEDC7649E39B16A6044044F3DF.description: review the process based on the criteria

BED59D52476740E3ABB33AE2FC0E1A07.description: determine how well the product or presentation meets the original information need based on the criteria

5C38D4AD7282486C9D304FC544F12489.description: review the criteria to be used in judging both the product (or presentation) and the process

7CC85C7CC6CB4CF283D8A73C0101B87E.description: Evaluate the information product and process

8F0C63159B734BCF87A2388EEE146C1B.description: develop a product or presentation to communicate the results of the research

172E41130A834F9587E142416855A296.description: choose a presentation format (e.g., speech, paper, web page, video, hypermedia)

876BDBB8695B4C299B172399986292E3.description: recognize the three common types of communication or presentation modes (written, oral, visual)

55CAA4696FEC4017B0BEF91870404E33.description: identify whether the purpose of the product or presentation is to inform, entertain, or persuade

616B619FECBD45049E25B818FC3BDEB5.description: identify the audience for the product or presentation

FF746BE790754AB7AAFF9C11EB269648.description: Communicate the results of research and inquiry in an appropriate format

856211F0A5BA45198AC61C0061566460.description: apply the information gathered to solve the information problem or question

9222EAFFB36D4C13972F2BA557B7D679.description: select information applicable to the information question

AB810833714040EF9F97AD086F2789B5.description: determine if information is relevant to the information question

96908A8974A14BEC921D8A5C0F19CBF2.description: identify new information and integrate it with prior knowledge

46BF6520F05141E89DD3268DD4BD7BCE.description: Interpret and use information to solve the problem or answer the question

93A9E6E888394A97A250E38F2216FA2C.description: list basic bibliographic sources for information used

4FA2C7687E974CBDBFE6CACBBA524904.description: organize information using simple outlining techniques

513FF20996B44B7A91AAE20A379C5CB0.description: arrange notes to help answer the information problem or question

9F36BDAB3FDF4594AB3B7E32F3F6DE49.description: recognize the need to identify the author of any information copied verbatim

25E33FE1D8A2488081380B114D6DDDA9.description: record the sources of information as notes are taken

B9E5D86D8E5948439D639A9B9CF4BD8E.description: take notes or record information in their own words

0EAFD724AFD14E238A86B60D620F6F72.description: choose resources appropriate to their interests, abilities, and information need

3E44E772F19949DC9D1AFFEFE2DFD570.description: identify the sponsoring organization or author for all resources

3FBB15A5C55A4B7EADC207ACB930943D.description: recognize that graphics and images can be used to convey a message

FEA27CD6C2EB4C40A9181DFD784DE8F9.description: determine timeliness and validity of information sources

C245AC359A0B40F9BA6033C564B8BDE7.description: differentiate between fiction and nonfiction resources

3D764887C258403793B53D8BDF91DBA4.description: preview selected resources using table of contents, index, and other simple scanning strategies

BF725BA8575B4AAEA99577D5E120AC68.description: Evaluate and select information from a variety of print, nonprint, and electronic formats

741427BAF6B94A64845AF67C1A29525D.description: locate information from preselected Internet sites and web pages

845684A3706C45D1B26AF79CE60BD45B.description: use the index or table of contents of a book, magazine, or reference set to locate specific information

FF9590BC68AF459EB75A73C238FC8620.description: use an encyclopedia, dictionary, almanac, and atlas in print or electronic formats

B97977968AE44219B85B25FB821F4FA7.description: search for information by keyword, author, title, and topic or subject

B8E40E91B36F4AC7A87A1CCA45144FB4.description: identify and use printed or electronic catalogs to access materials in the school library media center

020F992BFC9B478B8C5ABC8D705ED333.description: locate materials using the classification system of the school library media center

9EC302B1AB844386B017FC9E840F32A5.description: recognize that materials in the school library media center are organized in a systematic manner

9EF1C66926214843AE1A7004ACDEC7E1.description: list steps to follow in carrying out the information search

F16B76C8765D451996CC5674BB9025FF.description: recognize different ways to organize ideas, concepts, and phrases

AA6588530E6F41C68D04F2F3CBCFE0AC.description: identify keywords and phrases for each information source

C903C930CAAA4636956A079F5E386871.description: select more than one resource when appropriate

782CB0234C39475193C68C0D575B0289.description: evaluate possible sources based on currency, genre, and relevance to topic

E8F3816AB7684D5EBCD9B9507CB04D57.description: identify possible sources of information including print, nonprint, electronic, and human resources

306796E84BEB4E74ACC8291B8E23F3FF.description: determine a specific focus for the information search questions

F8C3F661D67A40DDBB02C721CB89AE84.description: formulate initial questions to define what additional information is needed

C4B2CB58440C4F81A149AD485E27FD3E.description: determine what is already known about the information problem or question

3FE9086452064F678F6A3F052FD67AD1.description: identify the information problem or question to be resolved

CE07BB978CB64AE28A660BE77C20C991.description: Students in Wisconsin will access, evaluate, and apply information efficiently and effectively from a variety of sources in print, nonprint, and electronic formats to meet personal and academic needs.

0EBFAC0C172F4EAEAFBEB9FD6C86F3AA.description: suggest ways to improve future productions or presentation

54D24701CCB0425D8EDD39931E24DB91.description: identify simple criteria for judging the quality of a production or presentation judge how well a particular production meets the identified criteria

A284CC70DF3345948A7D8B3130A9A258.description: explain how well the media and technology contributed to its impact

209452303BA146E7B6C5BAA523E53DBA.description: identify the media and technology used

9595F0A5E5A04A60815166FEF91FD50A.description: Evaluate the use of media and technology in a production or presentation

EE07966D9B8E4D648C9F79AE76393A49.description: create and present a short video or hypermedia program

DC21FB70A45740DCB0F90AB8AE6BFFE7.description: plan a multimedia production using an outline or storyboard

0918C7845762466A9673E12C3BB615F7.description: use draw, paint or graphics software to create simple signs, posters, banners, charts, visuals, etc.

3EF051A517404867978923C14A7F738B.description: Use media and technology to create and present information

AE99668BB4C2480491D90206AB594AEA.description: identify and use simple search engines and directories

01576AC6A6C743758F6CC479753D395D.description: use the functions of a web browser to navigate and save World Wide Web sites

0D7A16D2924C46F68B854926FC296002.description: log on and view information from preselected sites on the Internet

B4B6DB68EF164F7CAF26C52C8BB712B0.description: generate, send, retrieve, save, and organize electronic messages

4C5A36B6EA9343E2BA40024066D0533C.description: describe and explain an on-line information network

52C1CBC529D84382AAF082735FD5145E.description: Use a computer and communications software to access and transmit information

EB7F62A5C2014F22BE50019169795B7E.description: use a prepared spreadsheet template to enter and edit data, and to produce and interpret a simple graph or chart

DAB63EE8BDB2442594B3DE1FDE259E51.description: identify a spreadsheet and explain basic spreadsheet terms (e.g., column, row, cell)

79FDF31F7FF24088A374504E4527D5E8.description: use a prepared database template to enter and edit data, and to locate records

DDF59194BA8C4BBD8AD18DB26BBCD9B1.description: identify a database and define basic database terms (e.g., file, record, field)

72001888EA09454A80AC33F3640FA41F.description: explore special formatting features (e.g., borders, shading, centering, justification) of a word processing program

33E6C9F049274941882212756DBE44D2.description: demonstrate the text editing features of a word processing program (e.g., bold face, italics, underline, double spacing, different size and style of fonts) to produce a finished product

E536D5AD441C4FA0B87878ABEB9F2D77.description: edit a word-processed document using a spell checker

C8B5C0CB1283471EB181394DC6ED6F90.description: produce a document using a word processing program

FEDF037B8BC2401B9D9ECBC29DF311FF.description: identify and define basic word processing terminology (e.g., cursor, open, save, file, I-beam, window, document, cut, copy, paste)

5D34EF5EC7284CB6A6F4A35888971355.description: Use a computer and productivity software to organize and create information

8EA6BE1EFB2C4FB0B870CDC85AB015F2.description: incorporate graphics, pictures, and sound into another document

61C6E3E7A3194AF3BC90325CD3690591.description: create, save, move, copy, retrieve, and delete electronic files

BEA7D58741CC4498B1033FBCD12EDC16.description: demonstrate how to open and run a software program from a local storage device or network server

4112785204BF4702A83AFB9C918BB060.description: describe the purpose and use of a virus detection program

F657C60E244B4937B94B495F619F31BB.description: access information using common electronic reference sources (e.g., indexes, almanacs, on-line catalogs, encyclopedias)

275707FBA6B540B69FF326809FFB7D26.description: listen to and view common audio and video media

F2EB44EE97904EFABC4E9851EADED02E.description: recognize the common organizational characteristics of print media (e.g., title page, table of contents, copyright statement, index) differentiate among the common types of computer software (e.g., drawing programs, utilities, word processing, simulations)

59C2F69513E3415992F6A4DBE778A3E9.description: identify the wide variety of current media formats (e.g., video programs, magazines, computer software, audio cassettes, CD-ROM and DVD, newspapers, books, the Internet)

A107EC1CAF0748FFB5DA0C289EFA4734.description: Identify and use common media formats

214F6610829C48BB829A84D40BFE121D.description: operate basic audio and video equipment to listen to and view media programs

C189A0BEC4C040848927177890111258.description: solve problems using the basic four arithmetic functions of a calculator when appropriate

0628BB55B23341B7B66016F17BB27A3B.description: demonstrate the use of still and video cameras and scanners

5854ADA0ADC6440F9CC33AE94BB83B4F.description: save and backup files on a computer hard drive, storage medium, or server

9F47A33C9FAD45B5ACD4745EFCB9E55C.description: develop touch keyboarding techniques using both hands

593F6882609549EE87C68243561EFC9D.description: demonstrate the correct use of input devices (e.g., mouse, keyboard) and output devices (e.g., monitor, printer, speakers)

37978FF2A3564BC197B2596C3BAA30F6.description: demonstrate proper care and correct use of media and equipment

0F84F0A3353B4CFBB0FEBBA5BAA15325.description: identify and explain the functions of the components of a computer system (e.g., monitor, central processing unit, storage devices, keyboard, mouse, printer)

1051E00D565B4E3CA5051FDCAA4752D8.description: identify and define basic computer terminology (e.g., software, hardware, cursor, startup/shutdown, storage medium, file, memory)

CAC9F60AA94F4EA795EDCD6A276515E4.description: Use common media and technology terminology and equipment

4AA4858ADDEF4E6B81FF184E562FF60E.description: Students in Wisconsin will select and use media and technology to access, organize, create, and communicate information for solving problems and constructing new knowledge, products, and systems.
